TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit QueryCursorEventArgs extends System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs

remarks.format: ## Remarks A query cursor event is raised on <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> and <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> objects whenever the mouse pointer moves to a new location.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: The generic handler to call in a type-specific way.
The target to call the handler on.
Docs.summary: Invokes event handlers in a type-specific way, which can increase event system efficiency.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation casts the generic handler as a <xref:System.Windows.Input.QueryCursorEventHandler> and then invokes it. For details on this implementation pattern and the reasons for it, see <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeEventHandler%2A> and [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md).
